Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with two nozzles (one broken) with huge wick-holes, and reed-bundles between the volutes. The discus is decorated with a woman surprised by a snake coiled around a tree. The wide rounded shoulder has a central groove extending to the handle-ornament. The handle and ornament are missing; there is a raised feature terminating in a globule on the stem of the handle-ornament. In the centre of the small grooved base-ring is a raised point. Orange-brown clay, very micaceous. Plaster mould.
Curator's comments: For shape, compare Shier, L.A., 1978. ‘Terracotta Lamps from Karanis, Egypt’. Ann Arbor : University of Michigan Press, 304, from Karanis. Bibliography: JRS XLV, 1955, p.217.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1919)
